solution.sample: Sub-word units are needed in order to reduce the vocabulary size and have a manageable amount of embeddings and network weights. By using sub-word units the system is able to translate unknown words, i.e. words not appearing in the corpora used for training, because they can be segmented in smaller units that do appear in the training corpora and the system has learned to translate them. Sub-word units can be learned by using, among others, a method, called byte-pair encoding, that learns how to group the letters that form the words by attending to the frequency of the groupings in running texts.

taskDescription: Neural machine translation systems usually work by translating sub-word units rather than words. After reading section 7.1 of chapter 7, explain (1) the need for using sub-words units, (2) how their use affects the translation of unknown words, and (3) how they can be learned from corpora.
